column4: someone knows why monodevelop doesn't show up when i do an apt-cache search monodevelop, i've got main,restricted,universe and multiverse in my sources.list
I can't find it in synaptic either
it is in http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/m/monodevelop
but apt-cache doesn't find it :S
what's the difference between that and mono? is the mono package only the run time env?
exactly, monodevelop is an IDE
I remember the time when you just fired up your c-64 and hacked away in basic ;)
hehehe yeah, i had a radio shack trs8something
i really don't use monodevelop, i use vi, i just found that weird
why do you use mono/.NET?
i mean that monodevelop doesn't show up when i search for it
I was more thinking why mono instead of Java or something like that
i need to develop cross-platform apps, c# is, for me, more powerful than java
i really like java, but c# is better
Ok
do you develop apps or something??
not really. I tinker with lots of stuff. downloaded c# express beta to my xp box and I played around a little
ok
But I'll probably go with python on my linux box
python is good, ubuntu is full of it hehe
Yeah, and it's easy to be productive in it. Just starting out and i don't have to plow through 435 tutorials ;)
hehehe cool
It might not be the fastest language, but I'm not competing with J Carmack's 3D-engine :)
